param.name: Types of contaminants
param.dialogReference: Nitrogen, phosphorus, or nitrogen and phosphorus.

param.name: Consideration of NH₄-N
param.dialogReference: Consideration of NH₄-N

param.name: Source locations (point)
param.dialogReference: A point feature layer specifying the locations of the OSTDS.

param.name: Water bodies
param.dialogReference: Specifies the locations of water bodies. This layer serves to ensure that each plume terminates at the boundary of any water body. It is the same input as that used in the Particle Tracking module.

param.name: Particle paths
param.dialogReference: The particle paths corresponding to the Source locations, as calculated by the flow module. It is the output file of the particle tracking module. Using this file, the Transport module will calculate the average velocity (harmonic mean) and porosity (arithmetic mean) along each flow path. These values are then used for the calculation of each plume.

param.name: Output Plumes of NO₃-N
param.dialogReference: Name of output plumes of NO₃-N (raster).

param.name: Output Plumes of NH₄-N
param.dialogReference: Name of output plumes of NH₄-N (raster).

param.name: Output Plumes info of NO₃-N
param.dialogReference: Name of output information shapefile of NO₃-N (raster).

param.name: Output Plumes info of NH₄-N
param.dialogReference: Name of output information shapefile of NH₄-N (raster).

param.name: Output Plumes of PO₄-P
param.dialogReference: Name of output plumes of PO₄-P (raster).

param.name: Output Plumes info of PO₄-P
param.dialogReference: Name of output information shapefile of PO₄-P (raster).

param.name: Solution type
param.dialogReference: The form of the Domenico solution to use.

param.name: Plume warping control point spacing
param.dialogReference: This parameter is used to warp the plume to specific flow paths. It specifies the number of cells along the plume centerline (starting from the source location) which separates the control points used for warping. The control point spacing, along with the plume length and the value of the Plume Cell Size determines the number of control points for any given plume.

param.name: Plume warping method
param.dialogReference: The warping algorithm to use. Spline is recommended.

param.name: Threshold Concentration
param.dialogReference: The threshold value below which the nitrate concentration will be considered zero.

param.name: Postprocessing
param.dialogReference: This setting controls how the plumes that intersect a water body are handled.

param.name: Demenico Bdy.
param.expression: Specified Input Mass Rate | Specified Z
param.dialogReference: Whether specified input mass rate or specified Z.

param.name: Maximum plumes of continuous calculation for one time
param.displayname: Maximum plumes of continuous calculation for one time
param.expression: {Maximum plumes of continuous calculation for one time}
param.dialogReference: At some point, arcgis pro will crash due to a stack overflow. When this happens, please reduce this number and re-run the module.

param.name: Mass input of nitrogen [mg/d]
param.dialogReference: If the value of the Domenico Bdy. parameter is set to Specified_Input_Mass_Rate, then this input will be enabled. The value of the Min parameter represents a known input mass rate, in units of mass per time, from the constant concentration source plane. When this parameter is specified, the value of the Source Dim. Z parameter is automatically calculated. The mass units of Min must be the same as the mass units of C0 and the time units must be the same as the time units of the flow velocity magnitude. A value of 20000 mg/day per septic tank is a reasonable starting point for model calibration.

param.name: Mass input of phosphorus [mg/d]
param.dialogReference: If the value of the Domenico Bdy. parameter is set to Specified_Input_Mass_Rate, then this input will be enabled. The value of the Min parameter represents a known input mass rate, in units of mass per time, from the constant concentration source plane. When this parameter is specified, the value of the Source Dim. Z parameter is automatically calculated. The mass units of Min must be the same as the mass units of C0 and the time units must be the same as the time units of the flow velocity magnitude.

param.name: Source Dimension Y
param.dialogReference: The width Y (in map units) of the Domenico source plane.

param.name: Source Dimension Z
param.dialogReference: The depth Z (in map units) of the Domenico source plane. If specified input mass rate is chosen, Z will be calculated by the model based on mass input.

param.name: Maximum Z
param.dialogReference: Whether to limit the value of Z. In some extreme situations, when calculating Z based on the specified input mass rate, Z may result in very large value.

param.name: Zmax
param.dialogReference: The maximum Z value of the Domenico source plane when limiting the value of Z.

param.name: Plume cell size
param.dialogReference: The resolution of the grid (in map units) over which the Domenico solution will be evaluated. A smaller value will yield higher resolution plumes, at the expense of increased computation time and memory usage.

param.name: Volume Conversion Factor
param.dialogReference: This factor is used to convert volumes calculated from the units of length to the volume units used for concentration. For example, if the value of NO3 concentration was specified using the unit of mg/l, and the length units (units of the cell size, source dimensions, dispersivities, and length portion of the flow velocity magnitude units) are in meters, the conversion factor is 1000 since 1000 liters equals one cubic meter.

param.name: Bulk Density
param.dialogReference: Bulk density.

param.name: Concentration of NO₃-N
param.dialogReference: NO₃-N Concentration [mg/l]

param.name: NO₃-N Dispersivity αL
param.dialogReference: αL and αTH are the longitudinal and horizontal transverse dispersivities respectively.

param.name: NO₃-N Dispersivity αTH
param.dialogReference: αL and αTH are the longitudinal and horizontal transverse dispersivities respectively.

param.name: Denitrification Decay Rate
param.dialogReference: The first-order decay constant for NO3. This constant controls the amount of nitrate loss due to denitrification.

param.name: Concentration of NH₄-N
param.dialogReference: NH₄-N Concentration [mg/l]

param.name: NH₄-N Dispersivity αL
param.dialogReference: αL and αTH are the longitudinal and horizontal transverse dispersivities respectively.

param.name: NH₄-N Dispersivity αTH
param.dialogReference: αL and αTH are the longitudinal and horizontal transverse dispersivities respectively.

param.name: Nitrification Decay Rate
param.dialogReference: The first-order decay constant for NH4. This constant controls the amount of ammonium loss due to nitrification.

param.name: kd for NH₄-N
param.dialogReference: Distribution coefficient describes adsorbed concentrations

param.name: Concentration of PO₄-P [mg/l]
param.dialogReference: PO₄-P Concentration [mg/l]

param.name: PO₄-P Dispersivity αL [m]
param.dialogReference: PO₄-P Dispersivity αL [m]

param.name: PO₄-P Dispersivity αTH [m]
param.dialogReference: PO₄-P Dispersivity αTH [m]

param.name: Precipitation rate [mg/kg 1/day]
param.dialogReference: Precipitation rate.

param.name: Sorption isotherm
param.dialogReference: Linear sorption or Langmuir soprtion for phosphorus reactive transport. Phosphorus sorption is highly dependent on the specific conditions of the study area. Linear sorption is recommended when P concentration is less than or equal to 10 mg/L (McCray et al. 2005).

param.name: Linear distribution coefficient [L/kg]
param.dialogReference: Linear distribution coefficient.

param.name: The coefficient in langmuir equation [L/mg]
param.dialogReference: Langmuir coefficient.

param.name: Maximum sorption capacity [mg P / kg]
param.dialogReference: Maximum sorption capacity.
